displayName.text: Hudson High School of Learning Technologies

formattedAddress: 351 W 18th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 351 W 18th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
Most teachers are fun, kind, and understanding. Various of electives and events. Though the principle has a bad history with the students... Rules unfairly come and go every year. Can't take elevator with no health conditions.
Gymnasium is at the very top floor within a campus of schools; just a heads up.

text.text:
Most teachers are fun, kind, and understanding. Various of electives and events. Though the principle has a bad history with the students... Rules unfairly come and go every year. Can't take elevator with no health conditions.
Gymnasium is at the very top floor within a campus of schools; just a heads up.

originalText.text:
The school has one of worst principles ever. She once gave eveyone the month December off and almost all the students ended up failing that year. She lets people graduate at a third grade reading level which she isn't suppose to do. Self defence doesn't apply to her at all. Spends the school budget on a bunch of useless things which can be used for students, like supplies. Oh and if you're an 8th grader thinking about coming to the school, you can only go out for lunch once a week starting in January but the catch is that you have to be present at school all days the previous week. Also you share the building with 6 other schools and you have to walk up about 6-7 long flights to get to the gym and lunch room. The building has elevators but students are not allowed to use it without a pass and if you get caught, you get detention.

Honestly don't even try applying to this school it's a waste of your time and you'll regret it

One of the biggest mistakes of my life is applying to this school

The only good part about the school is the thicc male teachers. üò©üòçüí¶üëÄ

Ps.
You can get reboot (detention) for the stupidest things ever

Sincerely, Thomas Wayne

originalText.text: My son was part of the first graduating class for Hudson High School of Learning Tech.  It was a great experience for him. The communication between teachers and students was great.  They were very connected and informative with parents. It was a great 4 yrs for both my son and I.
